alert.note: Alert for Jewell (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 17 at 4:42AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Jewell, Nuckolls, Webster and southern Thayer Counties through 515 AM CDT... At 442 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Inavale to near Superior to near Chester. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and mainly hail up to around one- half inch. However, isolated pockets of slightly smaller hail to around penny size are possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Superior, Hebron, Red Cloud, Blue Hill, Deshler, Nelson, Lawrence, Chester, Guide Rock, Hardy, Ruskin, Byron, Hubbell, Oak, Gilead, Cowles, Webber, Nora, Rosemont and Inavale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
